intro: Bourreria bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian burrplant, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
